JOINT SION
Scanned with OKEN Scanner(2)
You are my husband. In return for my love for you, and with the intention of giving you some property free of charge, I hereby transfer to you, free of charge, the entire Durgada village survey No. 382, including the vacant land measuring 73.33 sq.m., various fruit trees, common roads, water resources, deposits, etc., which I have owned since the date of my father's death, and which I have owned since the date of my father's death, a property worth Rs. 1,47,000/-, literally one lakh forty-seven thousand rupees, and take possession of the said property on this very day. From now on, you shall be the full rightful owners of the said property, paying the Panchayat taxes yourself, and shall enjoy the said property freely and freely, with full rights of donation, sale, and possession, as you wish, throughout your generations. Therefore, I will remove all the encumbrances, encumbrances, and encumbrances, no matter when or from whom they may arise, at my own expense, and will continue to implement this settlement property under you without interruption. I will make you believe and trust that this property is an indisputable and undisputed property to which no other person has ever made any mortgages, sales, or other encumbrances, and I will write and issue this settlement deed in your name. This settlement property is hereby registered in the accounts of the Government in your name. This property is not assigned under Act 9/77.
I declare that there are no structures on the said Scheduled Property. I will be liable to pay the depreciation duty under Sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act if any such material particulars are found to be false.
Declaration
That the property as per the schedule mentioned in this deed belongs to me/us only,
That no other person has been previously encroached upon the said property,
That I/We shall be liable to the punishment mentioned in section 82 of the Registration Act, 1908, if I/We are found to have contravened the provisions of section 22B of the Registration Act, 1908
This is hereby certified
T. Mary

This document, which is not registered today, shall not be subject to any liability or responsibility of the Sub-Registrar, his/her office staff or the scribe who prepared the draft. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 197 of 2026, dated 12/Jan/2026, executed by Tiragati Meri, in favour of her husband, Tiragati Dasu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 73. 33 Sq. Yds, Located Nearby house number 5-28, comprised in survey number 382, situated in Durgada Village and Grama Panchayath, Gollaprolu Mandal, within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Prathipadu, is bounded as follows: North by: 22.0 Ft Road South by: 22.0 Ft Site Belongs to others East by: 30.3 Ft Site of Inti Durga West by: 30.0 Ft Site of Ugguralla Pampayya
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
